DOC.brief_summary: This randomize , double-blind , parallel group study compare efficacy safety subcutaneous ( sc ) versus intravenous ( iv ) administration tocilizumab participant moderate severe active rheumatoid arthritis . Participants randomize receive either tocilizumab 162 mg sc weekly plus iv placebo every 4 week , tocilizumab 8 mg/kg iv every 4 week plus sc placebo weekly double-blind period baseline Week 24 . The double-blind period follow 72-week open-label treatment switch sc iv administration . No placebo administer open-label phase . Participants continue stable dose disease-modifying antirheumatic drug ( DMARDs ) throughout study . Anticipated time study treatment 2 year .
DOC.brief_title: A Study Compare Subcutaneous Versus Intravenous Administration RoActemra/Actemra ( Tocilizumab ) Participants With Moderate Severe Active Rheumatoid Arthritis
